snippet: The opening of a chapter in Queens is a remarkable moment for the historically white organization, as 5 of the 13 members, including its founder, are black.
abstract: Daughters of the American Revolution mark a turning point in their history by opening a small Queens, NY, chapter that boasts five black members; historically white organization, whose members can prove they are related to someone who aided the American revolutionary cause, suffers from an ugly reputation for excluding blacks.
lead_paragraph: The opening of a chapter in Queens is a remarkable moment for the historically white organization, as 5 of the 13 members, including its founder, are black.

headline.seo: For Daughters of the American Revolution, More Black Members
headline.main: For Daughters of the American Revolution, a New Chapter
headline.print_headline: For Daughters of the Revolution, a New Chapter
